<details>
<summary>üß© Analysis chain</summary>

üèÅ Script executed:

```shell
#!/bin/bash
# Check latest `@types/newrelic` version on npm
echo "=== Latest `@types/newrelic` version and metadata ==="
curl -s https://registry.npmjs.org/@types/newrelic | jq '{latest: .["dist-tags"].latest, versions_available: (.versions | keys | length)}'

echo -e "\n=== Latest `@types/newrelic` version details ==="
curl -s https://registry.npmjs.org/@types/newrelic/latest | jq '{version: .version, publishedDate: .time.created}'

# Check newrelic package for built-in types and latest version
echo -e "\n=== Newrelic package latest version ==="
curl -s https://registry.npmjs.org/newrelic | jq '{latest: .["dist-tags"].latest}'

echo -e "\n=== Newrelic package type definitions ==="
curl -s https://registry.npmjs.org/newrelic/latest | jq '{types: .types, typings: .typings, version: .version}'
```

Repository: HutchisonSorbo/smalltalk.community

Length of output: 454

---



</details>

**Address type definition version mismatch with newrelic runtime package.**

The `@types/newrelic` package (v9.14.8) is significantly outdated relative to the `newrelic` runtime dependency (v13.10.0). Verification confirms that v9.14.8 is the latest available version of `@types/newrelic` on npm, and the `newrelic` package does not provide built-in TypeScript definitions. This major version gap means type definitions may be missing for APIs introduced in newrelic versions 10‚Äì13, potentially causing incomplete type coverage.

Consider investigating whether the v9 types adequately cover v13 API usage, or check with DefinitelyTyped maintainers about updating the `@types/newrelic` package.

<details>
<summary>ü§ñ Prompt for AI Agents</summary>

```
In `@package.json` at line 120, package.json currently lists
`@types/newrelic`@^9.14.8 while the runtime newrelic is v13.10.0, causing
missing/incorrect typings; decide and apply one of these fixes: (A) if you can,
pin newrelic to a v9-compatible release to match `@types/newrelic`, (B) remove
`@types/newrelic` and add a local ambient type stub (e.g., create
src/types/newrelic.d.ts with either specific declarations for the newrelic APIs
your code uses or a minimal fallback like declare module 'newrelic';) then run
tsc to find/implement any missing declarations, or (C) keep current versions and
add specific type augmentations for newer APIs used in your code; reference the
package names '@types/newrelic' and 'newrelic' and update package.json
accordingly, then re-run the type-check and CI to confirm the issue is resolved.
```

</details>
